snippet: Many Afghans have begun to complain that President Hamid Karzai besmirches the Americans for deadly drone strikes, while ignoring attacks by the Taliban.
abstract: Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai moderates his demands for signing security deal with United States but continues to insist that drone raids on Afghan homes must stop immediately; many in government are frustrated at Karzai's disparate reactions to civilian deaths from American and Taliban attacks.

byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin  and Habib Zahori  contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Many Afghans have begun to complain that President Hamid Karzai besmirches the Americans for deadly drone strikes, while ignoring attacks by the Taliban.

headline.main: Afghans Assail Karzai’s Disparate Views on Killings
headline.print_headline: Afghans Assail Karzai’s Disparate Views on Killings

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
